bibl.title: Fragile Hierarchies. The Urban Elites of Third-Century Roman Egypt.
bibl.note: Diss. Leiden Univ., 2003. - Preface. - Introduction. - Part One. Hierarchies: 1. Population and Urbanisation; - 2. The Urban System; - 3. The Distribution of Inequality; - 4. Elite Formation. - Part Two. Mobility and Continuity: 1. Cyclical Mobility; - 2. Elite Demography; - 3. Property Transmission; - 4. Continuity and Renewal. - Conclusion. - Appendix: The Councillors of Oxyrhynchos in the Third Century. - Bibliography. Indexes.
bibl.seg: TACOMA Laurens E., Fragile Hierarchies. The Urban Elites of Third-Century Roman Egypt. (Mnemosyne. Supplementum 271.)
Leiden, E.J. Brill, 2006, 8°, xiv-353 pp., 2 tabl., 3 figg., 1 carte. ISBN 90-04-14831-0. €103.

Diss. Leiden Univ., 2003. - Preface. - Introduction. - Part One. Hierarchies: 1. Population and Urbanisation; - 2. The Urban System; - 3. The Distribution of Inequality; - 4. Elite Formation. - Part Two. Mobility and Continuity: 1. Cyclical Mobility; - 2. Elite Demography; - 3. Property Transmission; - 4. Continuity and Renewal. - Conclusion. - Appendix: The Councillors of Oxyrhynchos in the Third Century. - Bibliography. Indexes.

C.R. par Richard Alston, JRS 97 (2007) pp. 292-293. - Roger S. Bagnall, JRA 20 (2007) pp. 639-642. - John Whitehorne, BibO 64 (2007) coll. 171-173. - Andrea Jördens, Gnomon 81 (2009) pp. 336-339. - Dominic Rathbone, CR N.S., 59 (2009) pp. 224-225. - Marie Drew-Bear, Topoi 16 (2009) pp. 619-622.
